intro: Phacelia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Phacelia glandulifera is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators and as a forage plant for livestock.
